title.narrative: Provision of integrated shelter support and Nutrition services to the most vulnerable people in NW Syria (under Envelope 1)

description.narrative:
**Mercy-USA for Aid and Development in this project will support the most vulnerable people in NW Syria in two components: 1-Provision of better dignified shelter solution by providing innovative shelter approach which comprises steel metal frame and sandwich panels: Module #2 "Design Attached" :Shelter unit size is 25.2 m2 from them 18.93 sq. meter for two rooms plus 6.3 m2 for kitchen, toilet, and bathroom- for 46 HH in Muslim Care Camp and 124 HH in Al Shaikh Mustafa camp The two targeted camps in Harbanush community within Maaret Tamsrin sub-district to accommodate 170 HH, 910 individuals (Men 199- Women 234- Boys 234- Girls 243) with ramp where needed to ensure accessibility for people with disabilities in all shelter units and facilities, privacy, and safety for all vulnerable groups. Leveling will be provided to the shelter ground with thickness of 15 cm with compaction and humidification for appropriate installation for shelter units Furthermore, Mercy-USA will install special latrines from the Turkish type with handrails for persons with disability to access the facilities. Lighting pools will be provided in the targeted camps for the main roads to ensure GBV mitigating and protection risks might arise The shelter units will be installed and infrastructure preparations, and shelter leveling by contractor.
2-Comprehensive nutrition services for vulnerable populations in 38 communities and 134 camps in the following subdistricts :Maaret Tamsrin, Ariha, Harim, Jisr-Ash-Shugur
15 Rapid Response Teams (RRTs) will provide integrated nutrition, health, and protection life-saving services in the targeted areas and camps (Attached) Each RRT will work in specific locations and will cover (PLW and children under 5) -1RRTs in Maaret Tamsrin: the coverage will include but not limited to Muslim Care and Al Shaikh Mustafa camps which are covered by shelter component for integration approach -1RRTs in Ariha -8RRts in Harim -5RRts in Jisr-Ash-Shugur
These RRTs will work in parallel and in coordination with the available health facilities in the target areas. The RRTs will provide equitable, comprehensive lifesaving preventive and curative nutrition services for vulnerable population groups.
the rapid response will adopt the new agreed RRTs SOPs (attached) which include
- Assess and screen nutritional status among the children under 5 and distribute nutritional supplies to them where needed. -Screen the children under 5 and PLWs and refer the ones with dangers signs and medical problems to the available health facilities. -Manage the malnutrition cases (SAM without medical complications and MAM cases among children and PLW) . -Counseling the PLWs and caregivers of children under 24 months of age and providing messages on IYCF-E recommended practices to mothers who have malnourished children. -Distributing micronutrients and nutrition supplies for the PLWs and children. -Reporting to the cluster any distribution of breast milk substitute. -Other agreed activities according to the TOR
Also, a pre and rapid coordination combined with referrals will be in place if the team notices or identifies any sign of abuse or violence among children under 5 and or mothers. All cases of violence against women and children will be referred to pre-identified cases
*Accountability to Affected population (AAP) will be given high priority in this project by consultation, communications and sharing information with beneficiaries during all project phases, as well as using complaints and feedback mechanism which is accessible to all beneficiaries especially the most vulnerable such as persons with disabilities, the elderly, women and girls, thus taking corrective actions based on need. *HLP documents will be given high attention, so all HLP documents for all selected camp should be available to be cleared
